text: this was such a great game, I'm one to not study patterns and just rush it, sometimes you blow though the maps real quick and sometimes you die and die and die til you learn everything and blow through it, at least there was bumping music the whole time blastin. (] - . - [)

author: Phenomdozer

text: How come you haven't contributed any music to the Hotline Miami games? Your album is great! As a matter of fact, I replaced some of the oggs for my copy with music from Numéro I.
author: Quikquik Hassan

text: @Quikquik Hassan I'd love to contribute a track or two for a Hotline Miami game, but I'm not sure they'd be interested as they've already found a lot of extremely talented composers. Wouldn't hurt to ask them though!
author: SupraDarky

text: Hotline Miami is cheating, you may as well upload the entire soundtrack.
author: Gamer 2: Gamer No More

text: Really looking forward to Hotline Miami 2, the soundtrack playing a major part. This track always put me right in the mood of killing everyone as quickly and efficiently as possible (out of context, this sounds pretty terrible), especially with the instant retries motivating you to persevere until the perfect run.
author: SupraDarky

text: You're absolutely spot on. This is perfect massacre music but sounds bad when you say something like that out of context :). First impressions count too I think as I believe this is the track for the first mission in the game.
author: Mark Goninon

text: Hotline Miami tracks also make good racing game music.
author: Colmarr

text: I don't know if I agree with your parenthetical statement there Supra; I have to say that I like this track even out of context. I still think it's super exciting
